classes module

class classes.Course(course_id, course_name, instructor)[source]

Bases: object

A class representing a course with course ID, course name, an instructor, and a list of enrolled students.

Parameters:

  • course_id (int) – The unique ID of the course, must be a positive integer.

  • course_name (str) – The name of the course.

  • instructor (Instructor) – The instructor assigned to teach the course.

Raises:

ValueError – If any of the provided parameters are invalid.

add_student(student)[source]

Adds a student to the course’s enrolled student list.

Parameters:

student (Student) – The student object to enroll in the course.

Raises:

ValueError – If the provided student is not of type Student.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

to_json()[source]

Converts the course details to a JSON string, including the instructor and enrolled students.

Returns:

A JSON representation of the course.

Return type:

json

class classes.Instructor(name, age, email, instructor_id)[source]

Bases: Person

A class representing an instructor, inheriting from Person, with additional instructor ID and a list of assigned courses.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the instructor.

  • age (int) – The age of the instructor, must be a positive integer.

  • email (str) – The email address of the instructor, must follow a valid email format.

  • instructor_id (int) – The unique ID of the instructor, must be a positive integer.

Raises:

ValueError – If any of the provided parameters are invalid.

assign_course(course)[source]

Assigns the instructor to teach a given course.

Parameters:

course (Course) – The course object to assign the instructor to.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

to_json()[source]

Converts the instructor’s details to a JSON string.

Returns:

A JSON representation of the instructor.

Return type:

josn

class classes.Person(name, age, email)[source]

Bases: object

A base class representing a person with name, age, and email attributes.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the person.

  • age (int) – The age of the person, must be a positive integer.

  • email (str) – The email address of the person, must follow a valid email format.

Raises:

ValueError – If any of the provided parameters are invalid.

introduce()[source]

Prints a statement introducing the person with their name and age.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

class classes.Student(name, age, email, student_id)[source]

Bases: Person

A class representing a student, inheriting from Person, with additional student ID and a list of registered courses.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the student.

  • age (int) – The age of the student, must be a positive integer.

  • email (str) – The email address of the student, must follow a valid email format.

  • student_id (int) – The unique ID of the student, must be a positive integer.

Raises:

ValueError – If any of the provided parameters are invalid.

register_course(course)[source]

Registers the student for a given course.

Parameters:

course (Course) – The course object to register the student for.

Raises:

ValueError – If the provided course is not of type Course.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

to_json()[source]

Converts the student’s details to a JSON string.

Returns:

A JSON representation of the student.

Return type:

json
